answers.author: Eric Cline
answers.text:
It is public information; at least in Michigan it is and I would imagine that it is similar in most other states. The easiest way to get the information is to just ask the community (usually the Finance Department or whoever handles that function). Most communities will just give you the information.
If not file a Freedom of Information Act request with the community. Just make sure that you comply with the requirements of your particular law on this issue.

answers.author: Martha Perego
answers.text:
You can also go directly to the source!  Call the city manager's office. Another source is the city clerk who would have the minutes from the meeting where the governing body approved the manager's agreement as well as a copy of the agreement.
